p: Concerning the communicable diseases of sheep and goats, 17 diseases have been included, as shown in Table 1. The serious exotic epizootics, artiodactyls of the Artiodactyls, comprise FMD, rinderpest, Rift Valley fever, and rabies. Exotic virosis comprise sheep and goat pox. Pestes de petits ruminants (PPR) within the "multi-species" category for other endemic diseases in Italy are blue tongue, tuberculosis, brucellosis, and anthrax. Other recognized diseases of community interest such as epididymitis of the ram, Q fever, and paratuberculosis have a low veterinary impact within the EU and are generally easily treatable.
